intro: Homalobus amphidoxus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
